results.title: Oliver Twist by Charles Dickens [study extract]
results.creator_credit: Cineguild, Anthony Havelock-Allan, Ronald Neame and David Lean
results.brief_description: The sequences of Oliver (John Howard Davies) arriving in London, meeting the Artful Dodger, his introduction to Fagin (Alec Guiness) and Fagin’s lessons in pickpocketing. Oliver’s first practical experience of it, and the chase through London streets. Cast includes Robert Newton, Kay Walsh and Francis L. Sullivan. Excerpt from the film “Oliver Twist” directed by David Lean.

results.title: Oboe and coranglais
results.creator_credit: Milton Ingerson and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Basic Music Techniques”.
One of a series of films designed to assist the musician and the music lover. In this film professional musicians show how the oboe and the coranglais are played, demonstrate their range and tone, and show how to care for them. Musicians: Rosemary Stimson, Jiri Tancibudek.

results.title: Notes for a film about Donna and Gail
results.creator_credit: Julian Biggs, ONF | NFB and Don Owen
results.brief_description: The story of two young women who go to the city to work in a dress factory, and who share a room to ease their expenses and their loneliness. The film shows the currents that brought them together and the facets of their natures that first made them seem compatible but eventually drove them apart. Their story reflects, to a degree, the situation of anyone who has ever shared the life of another.

results.title: North Sea
results.creator_credit: Alberto Cavalcanti, GPO Film Unit and Harry Watt
results.brief_description: Made to publicise the English GPOs ship to shore radio service, this was the first documentary film to pay its way in Britain by getting theatrical release in commercial cinemas, and for this achievement it was a special triumph for the pioneering documentary filmmakers. “North Sea” tells the story of the big gale of 1937. The crew of the trawler “John Gillman” are introduced as they leave their homes in Aberdeen to rejoin their ship. As the “John Gillman” and crew ride out the gale, wives and families wait anxiously at the Wick Radio Station. After 48 hours of silence a signal finally comes through.

results.title: Ninety degrees south
results.brief_description: This famous film is the official record of Captain Scott’s last Expedition to the Antarctic in 1912. The film tells of the hazardous journey to the South and includes the last photographs of Scott, Evans, Wilson, and Oates, who were lost. In photographing this film, Herbert Ponting, “Camera Artist” to the Expedition, faced great hardships and narrowly escaped death on a number of occasions. 1934 soundtrack added to original silent documentary of 1912.

results.title: Nightmail
results.creator_credit: GPO Film Unit, John Grierson, Basil Wright and Harry Watt
results.brief_description: Classic British documentary recounting the journey of the ‘Postal Special’ train from London to Glasgow. Carrying no passengers, the postal staff sort mail on board and receive and despatch mailbags ‘en route’. The non professional cast performed scripted scenes, giving a human dimension to the mechanics of mail delivery. Along with a dry factual voice-over, the soundtrack offered music by composer Benjamin Britten and verse by W.H. Auden.

results.title: A Night to remember [study extract]
results.creator_credit: William MacQuitty, Rank Organisation Film Productions and Roy Baker
results.brief_description: An extract from “A Night to remember”, directed by Roy Baker and based on the book by Walter Lord. Shows the Captain giving the order to abandon ship and the subsequent reactions of the passengers and the crew. Cast includes Kenneth More, Laurence Naissmith, Thomas Andrews, Michael Goodliffe.

results.title: The New alchemists
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, ONF | NFB and Dorothy Todd Henaut
results.brief_description: On a small farm, a group of people explore the possibilities for more self-sustaining communities involving interrelated food-producing systems and small scale technology. From the “Challenge for change” series”.

results.title: The Nazis strike
results.creator_credit: Anatole Litvak, Frank Capra and United States. War Dept.
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Why we fight”.
This unnerving film examines the growth of Hitler’s Nazi Party, which became mankind’s single most destructive force. Includes Hitler’s closest aides and key figures, the denouncing of all religious belief as weak and petty, and the atrocities which promised German world domination. Concludes with the invasions of Austria, Czechoslovakia and Poland. This film was originally intended for the orientation of members of the armed forces during the war. Narrated by Walter Huston and Captain Anthony Veiller. Editing, Major William Hornbeck. Music, Dimitri Tiomkin.
